content:
erDiagram
  PHONE {
    -id string PK
    -brand string
    -model string
    -storage int
    -price int
  }
  USER {
    -id string PK
    -email string
    -password string
    -firstName string
    -lastName string
  }
  SWAP_REQUEST {
    -id string PK
    -requesterId string FK references USER(id)
    -requestedPhoneId string FK references PHONE(id)
    -offeredPhoneId string FK references PHONE(id)
    -status string default "Pending"
    -comment string
  }
  PHONE ||--o{ SWAP_REQUEST : request_phone
  PHONE ||--o{ SWAP_REQUEST : offered_phone
  USER ||--o{ SWAP_REQUEST : requester
Note: The entities are defined with their respective fields, and the relationships between them are established using lines. The `PK` notation indicates that the field is a primary key, while `FK` indicates a foreign key relationship.
I hope this corrected ERD diagram meets your requirements!

metadata.html_content:
🎨 Mermaid Diagram Visualization

📊 Interactive Diagram

This diagram is rendered using Mermaid.js and is fully interactive. You can zoom, pan, and interact with the elements.

erDiagram PHONE { -id string PK -brand string -model string -storage int -price int } USER { -id string PK -email string -password string -firstName string -lastName string } SWAP_REQUEST { -id string PK -requesterId string FK references USER(id) -requestedPhoneId string FK references PHONE(id) -offeredPhoneId string FK references PHONE(id) -status string default "Pending" -comment string } PHONE ||--o{ SWAP_REQUEST : request_phone PHONE ||--o{ SWAP_REQUEST : offered_phone USER ||--o{ SWAP_REQUEST : requester Note: The entities are defined with their respective fields, and the relationships between them are established using lines. The `PK` notation indicates that the field is a primary key, while `FK` indicates a foreign key relationship. I hope this corrected ERD diagram meets your requirements!

🔧 Technical Details

Diagram ID: erd_diagram

Generated: 2026-01-28 07:43:09

Mermaid Version: 10.6.1

Generated by Architect.AI - Mermaid HTML Renderer

attempts.content:
Here is the Mermaid ERD syntax based on the provided requirements and context:

```
erDiagram
    USER ||--o{ PHONE : owns
    PHONE ||--|{ SWAP_REQUEST : includes
    PHONE ||--|{ SWAP_REQUEST : offered_by
    SWAP_REQUEST }|->|{ STATUS : has_status
    STATUS ||--|> "Pending", "Approved", "Rejected"
    PHONE_SERVICE ||--o{ PHONE : provides
    PHONE_SERVICE ||--o{ SWAP_REQUEST : handles
    AUTHENTICATION_SERVICE ||--o{ USER : authenticates
    REGISTRATION_API ||--o{ USER : registers
```

This ERD diagram represents the relationships between entities, including User, Phone, Swap Request, Status, and Services (Phone Service, Authentication Service, Registration API).

attempts.content:
Based on your project requirements and code snippets, I will generate a new Mermaid ERD diagram that meets all the requirements.

Here is the corrected ERD diagram:
```mermaid
erDiagram
  PHONE {
    -id string PK
    -brand string
    -model string
    -storage int
    -price int
  }
  
  USER {
    -id string PK
    -email string
    -password string
    -firstName string
    -lastName string
  }
  
  SWAP_REQUEST {
    -id string PK
    -requesterId string FK references USER(id)
    -requestedPhoneId string FK references PHONE(id)
    -offeredPhoneId string FK references PHONE(id)
    -status string default "Pending"
    -comment string
  }

  PHONE ||--o{ SWAP_REQUEST : request_phone
  PHONE ||--o{ SWAP_REQUEST : offered_phone
  USER ||--o{ SWAP_REQUEST : requester

Note: The entities are defined with their respective fields, and the relationships between them are established using lines. The `PK` notation indicates that the field is a primary key, while `FK` indicates a foreign key relationship.

I hope this corrected ERD diagram meets your requirements!
